alert.note: Alert for Webster (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 30 at 5:31PM CDT until May 30 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN WEBSTER COUNTY... At 531 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Fort Dodge. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Numerous reports of flooded roadways in Fort Dodge with conditions slowly improving. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fort Dodge, Moorland and Lizard Creek State Recreation Area. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
